thread.title: Ground News - Traffic stop leads to meth, fentanyl seizure in West Glenwood
thread.title_full: Ground News - Traffic stop leads to meth, fentanyl seizure in West Glenwood

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Traffic stop leads to meth, fentanyl seizure in West Glenwood
text:
Summary by Ground News Jason Perpich was arrested for possessing more than an ounce of meth and nearly a half ounce of fentanyl, along with a small amount of alprazolam. He is facing multiple charges, including three counts of unlawful distribution, one count of distribution of a controlled substance, possession of drug paraphernalia, and improper license plate. postindependent.com Center High Factuality Traffic stop leads to meth, fentanyl seizure in West Glenwood A routine traffic stop by the Garfield County Sheriff’s Office led to an unexpected drug seizure on Dec. 23, involving a suspect identified as Jason Perpich. Perpich was arrested for possessing more than an ounce of meth and nearly a half ounce of fentanyl, along with a small amount of alprazolam.
